skill.name: react:components
skill.description: Converts Stitch design exports into modular React components with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Vite. Uses AST-based validation to ensure code quality and adherence to architectural standards.
skill.summary: Transform Stitch designs into production-ready React components with automated validation.
skill.author: google-labs-code

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected 107 pattern matches, but manual review confirms nearly all are false positives. The skill uses a bash script (fetch-stitch.sh) to download design files from Stitch URLs via curl, and a Node.js validator (validate.js) that reads component files for AST analysis. Both operations are legitimate and necessary for the skill's design-to-code workflow. No malicious intent detected.

low_findings.title: External Network Fetch via curl

low_findings.confidence_reasoning: The script is a documented helper for fetching Stitch design exports. Arguments are passed from SKILL.md instructions, but the purpose is clear and legitimate.

low_findings.confidence_reasoning: File reading is limited to the validation workflow and uses standard Node.js fs operations for AST parsing.

content.user_title: Convert Stitch Designs to React Components
content.value_statement: Transform visual designs from Stitch into clean, modular React code with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS. Eliminate manual coding from design mockups with automated AST validation ensuring consistent code quality.
actual_capabilities: Converts Stitch design exports into modular React components with TypeScript interfaces
Generates Vite-compatible project structure with proper file organization
Extracts Tailwind configuration from design HTML and maps to theme tokens
Validates components using AST analysis to catch hardcoded styles and missing interfaces
Creates custom hooks for business logic separation following Atomic Design patterns
Produces mock data files to decouple components from static content
limitations: Requires Stitch MCP server access for design metadata retrieval
Designed for desktop viewport designs (2560px base width)
Validation depends on @swc/core which must be installed in the target project
May require manual adjustments for complex interactive behaviors

use_cases.title: Rapid UI Prototyping
use_cases.description: Frontend developers can convert approved Stitch designs into working React components within minutes, accelerating the handoff from design to development.

use_cases.title: Design System Migration
use_cases.description: Teams migrating from design tools to codebases can batch-convert Stitch screens into a consistent component library with standardized TypeScript interfaces.

use_cases.title: Vite Project Scaffolding
use_cases.description: Developers starting new Vite projects can generate production-ready component foundations with proper Tailwind theming and data architecture already in place.

best_practices: Always run validation (npm run validate) on generated components to catch hardcoded styles early
Use the gold-standard-card.tsx example as a reference for proper component structure
Extract all business logic into custom hooks and static content into mockData.ts
anti_patterns: Do not generate monolithic single-file components; follow Atomic Design modularity
Avoid hardcoding hex color values; always map to Tailwind theme tokens from style-guide.json
Do not skip the architecture checklist review; it catches common structural issues

faq.question: What is Stitch and why do I need this skill?
faq.answer: Stitch is a design tool that exports visual designs. This skill automates the conversion of those designs into working React code, saving hours of manual coding.

faq.question: Why does the skill use a bash script instead of standard HTTP requests?
faq.answer: The fetch-stitch.sh script handles Google Cloud Storage redirects and TLS/SNI handshakes that can fail with standard fetch implementations. It ensures reliable downloads of design assets.

faq.question: What does the AST validation check for?
faq.answer: The validator ensures components have proper TypeScript Props interfaces and detects hardcoded hex color values that should use Tailwind theme classes instead.

faq.question: Can I customize the generated component structure?
faq.answer: Yes. The component-template.tsx file serves as the base template. You can modify it to change the default component structure, and the skill will use your customized template.

faq.question: What if the Stitch download URL expires?
faq.answer: Stitch URLs are signed and time-limited. If a fetch fails, the skill will report the error and you may need to regenerate the design export in Stitch to get a fresh URL.

faq.question: Does this skill work with mobile designs?
faq.answer: The skill prioritizes desktop viewport (2560px) as the base layout. Mobile-responsive variations can be added manually after the initial component generation.
